title: The Nature and development of affection
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychology - Research
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Animal experimentation
description: An experiment with chimpanzees. One animal is placed in a compartment with a wired cage source of milk, a "wire mother", another is placed with a similar wire source of milk but this is covered with a furry material and is known as the "cloth mother". Experiments contrast the social behaviour and the amount of affection which grows with each animal and "mother". Towards the end a human baby is shown to be attracted to a cloth mother. The University of Wisonsin Department of Psychology, Primate Laboratory with Dr. Harry F. Harlow.
